job title: Sr. Systems Data Engineer with Polygraph
job description:
Description

• Provide assistance with dashboard design ideas to development team in support of client
  • Integrate multiple data streams and feeds from networks, infrastructure services, mission/business application into near, real-time dashboards for use in trouble shooting and the presentation of situational awareness briefings to leadership
  • Utilize pre-built dashboards/add-ons within Splunk system and be able to create custom Splunk dashboards and search queries to meet the customer’s needs
  • Provide recommendations/action plans for incorporating new data streams to present additional visualizations
  • Perform software requirements, system integration activities, lead research, designs develops and test software and tools to include development of new work product or enhancing existing applications, system or embedded products
  • Conduct appropriate investigation and support resolution and technical solution reporting
  • Provide initial problem resolution where possible and reporting
  • Assist customer with data interpretation for ETL ingestion and quality assurance
  • Generate, monitor and track incidents/events through to resolution

    Qualifications

    • Bachelor’s degree in related discipline and 12+ years' experience. Additional experience in lieu of degree.
  • 10+ years’ experience in Cyber security
  • Active/current TS/SCI clearance with polygraph
  • Possess exceptional knowledge of customer data sets
  • Experience working in Windows environment
Desired Qualifications
  • Advanced understanding of specific enterprise environments that direct the correlation of system data for mission impact
  • IC experienced desired
  • Experience with custom scripting desired: Python, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, SQL, D3
  • Experience writing Splunk queries in Splunk Programming Language (SPL)
  • Splunk Certified Power User Certificaiton
